user_question: How can I creatively tutor a child in understanding the concept of gravity using everyday objects?
final_answer: You can creatively tutor a child about gravity by using a ball and a ramp to demonstrate how gravity pulls objects downwards. Additionally, you can use a feather and a book to show how air resistance affects falling objects differently.
